title: Challenges Volitional Sheet
description: Volitional coping options for IVF-related challenges, converted from CSV.

scenarios.text: If I’m worried about treatment before it’s started

options.label: Practice relaxation techniques (mindfulness, deep breathing)
Seek pre-treatment counselling or fertility coaching
Talk openly with your partner or support group about fears
Focus on controllable factors (sleep, diet, information)

scenarios.text: If I feel a stigma around IVF treatment

options.label: Connect with online/peer support groups
Educate close friends/family about infertility to reduce stigma
Practice self-compassion — infertility is a medical condition, not a personal failure

scenarios.text: If I feel pressure from my family or friends when we talk about treatment

options.label: Set healthy boundaries and limit fertility-related discussions
Communicate clearly with family about your needs
Engage a counsellor to practice responses to pressure situations

scenarios.text: If I feel worried about the cost of treatment

options.label: Save in advance or explore clinic financing options
Research the true cost of medications and procedures
Budget for multiple cycles realistically to reduce future pressure
Attend pre-IVF education sessions
Request detailed treatment timelines and expectations
Prepare mentally and physically — rest, nutrition, planning time off

scenarios.text: If I’m worried about the treatment not working

options.label: Ask your clinic for realistic success rates based on age and health
Set emotional “check-in points” between decisions
Accept that uncertainty is part of the process — plan flexible next steps

scenarios.text: If I feel physically unwell during treatment

options.label: Take time off work
Preparing mentally
Practising self-care

scenarios.text: If I’m worried about how my body will react to the treatment

options.label: Research the effects of treatment
Know possible side effects
Prepare the body to be in an optimal condition
Take treatment one step at a time

scenarios.text: If my work or daily activities are affected during treatment

options.label: Plan in advance
Take time off
Arrange work around treatment
Seek support from the employer
Communicate with work colleagues

scenarios.text: If I feel physically unwell during treatment

options.label: Counselling
Seeking support from family, friends, partner and support group
Remain positive
Hopeful and optimistic about treatment success
Learn from others
Take one thing at a time

scenarios.text: If treatment starts to affect on my relationship

options.label: Open, honest and frequent communication with partner
Plan to spend time with partner
Engage in fun activities
Support and understanding for each other in counselling

scenarios.text: If I’m worried that my cycle won’t be successful

options.label: Counselling
Seeking support from family, friends, partner and support group
Remain positive
Hopeful and optimistic about treatment success
Being realistic about treatment success from the start
Get advice from individuals who have previous experience
